result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hugo L Hernandez Corado

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Hugo L Hernandez Corado appeared by video.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for Hugo L Hernandez Corado.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Brenda Bartholomew appeared by Zoom and was sworn in.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Marchan was just appointed last week and still needs discovery.  Court sets another status date in December.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Hugo L Hernandez Corado appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Dawn Maldonado in court in person and is sworn in.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises he cannot afford a private attorney.  Court inquires if the defendant has applied for representation with the Public Defender's office.  Defendant advises he called the Public Defender's office and does not qualify.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel in October.  Court advises the defendant he should appear early for his next court date to make sure he can fill out the petition for court appointed attorney.  Court also advises the defendant he must appear in person for the next court date.  Spanish Interpreter needed for the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Goodwill/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:11 PM Defendant Hugo L Hernandez Corado in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, due to language barrier.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
